bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 151 (Thursday, September 19, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BUTTERFIELD:H.R. 4412.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Under Article I, Section 8, Clause 3 of the Constitution,Congress has the power to collect taxes and expend funds toprovide for the general welfare of the United States.Congress may also make laws that are necessary and proper forcarrying into execution their powers enumerated under ArticleI.[Page H7836]

item.title: A bill to prohibit the Bureau of the Census from including citizenship data in the legislative redistricting data prepared by the Bureau.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

summary.text: This bill prohibits the Bureau of the Census from including information regarding U.S. citizenship in its legislative redistricting data.

bill.title: To prohibit the Bureau of the Census from including citizenship data in the legislative redistricting data prepared by the Bureau.

item.title: To prohibit the Bureau of the Census from including citizenship data in the legislative redistricting data prepared by the Bureau.
To prohibit the Bureau of the Census from including citizenship data in the legislative redistricting data prepared by the Bureau.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
